solution.text:
Mass of Nitrogen \((m) = _{k}_ kg = _{{1000*k}}_\) g
Rise in Temperature \((\Delta T) = _{j}_^ \circ C\)
Molecular Mass of \(N_2 (M) = \) 28 g
\(R = 8.3 \frac{J}{mol\;K}\)
Number of moles \((n) = \frac {m}{M} = \frac{_{{1000*k}}_}{28} = _{{1000*k/28}}_\)

\(C_p = \frac {7}{2} \times R = _{{3.5 * 8.3}}_\)

\(\Delta Q = n \times C_p \times \Delta T = _{{1000*k/28}}_ \times 29.05 \times _{j}_ = _{{1000*29.05 * j * k/28}}_\) J
The amount of heat that needs to be supplied : \(_{{1000*29.05 * j * k/28}}_\) J

content.text: What amount of heat must be supplied to _{k}_ kg of nitrogen at room temperature to raise its temperature by _{j}_ \(^\circ\) C at constant pressure ? The molecular mass of \(N_2 = 28 g ; R = 8.3 \frac{J}{mol\;K} ; C_p = \frac {7}{2} \times R\)
